tn.text: Solomon marries an Egyptian.

tn.ref: Solomon allied himself by marriage with Pharaoh king of Egypt
tn.text: Solomon became the son-in-law of Pharaoh king of Egypt so the two kings would work together and fight together against their enemies.
She was still in the city of David after he had finished building.
"the temple"

tn.ref: no house had yet been built
tn.text: This can be translated in active form. AT: "no one had yet built a house" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
The word "name" is a metonym for the person, and "for the name" refers to worshiping the person. AT: "in which people would worship Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: walking in the statutes of David his father
tn.text: How one lives one's life is spoken of as walking on a path. AT: "obeying the laws that David his father had made" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
God asks Solomon what he can do for Solomon.
"the most famous place for makings sacrifices" or "the most important altar"

tn.ref: Ask! What should I give you?
tn.text: "Ask me for whatever you want and I will give it to you." or "What do you want? Ask and I will give it to you."
Solomon responds to God's question.

tn.ref: You have shown great covenant faithfulness
tn.text: "You have been very faithful to your agreement"

tn.ref: because he walked before you in trustworthiness, in righteousness, and in uprightness of heart
tn.text: Walking is a metaphor for the way one lives. The abstract nouns "trustworthiness," "righteousness," and "uprightness" can be translated as adjectives. AT: "because he was trustworthy and righteous, and his heart was upright" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
A sincere person is spoken of as one whose heart is upright. AT: "and he was sincere" or "and he spoke the truth and did what was good" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
The "son" is Solomon. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_pronouns]])
"to rule in his place" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"now." Solomon is speaking not of one day, but of the years he had already been ruling.
Solomon asks for wisdom.
Solomon speaks as if he is another person to show respect to Yahweh. AT: "me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_pronouns]])

tn.ref: I am only a little child
tn.text: Solomon is saying that he is like a child who does not know as much as a father. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: I do not know how to go out or come in
tn.text: This is hyperbole for not knowing anything about what he is supposed to do. AT: "I do not know the right way to do things" or "I do not know how to be the king" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])

tn.ref: For who is able to judge this great people of yours?
tn.text: Solomon asks a question to emphasize that he knows that no one can judge. AT: "No one is able to judge this great people of yours." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
God gives Solomon wisdom and more.
The "life" is a metonym for the power to kill. AT: "the power to kill your enemies" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: now I will do all you asked of me when you gave me your request
tn.text: "I will do what you asked me to do when you spoke with me"

tn.ref: I give you a wise and an understanding heart
tn.text: The heart is a metonym for what a person thinks and desires. AT: "I make you able to be wise and to understand many things" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: walk in my ways to keep
tn.text: Living one's life is spoken of as walking on a path. AT: "live as I want you to live and obey" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
"days" represents Solomon's life. AT: "make you live a long time" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
The word "behold" here shows that Solomon saw something interesting.
Two prostitutes ask Solomon to make a decision.
The two prostitutes tell Solomon their story.
It may be helpful to state that this caused the baby to die. AT: "accidentally rolled on top of her baby and smothered him" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
The woman speaks as if she were speaking of someone else to show that she respects Solomon. AT: "I" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_pronouns]])
Two prostitutes continue to share their story with Solomon.
This means to feed her baby milk from her breast.
"before Solomon" or "while Solomon could see and hear them"
Solomon makes a decision for the two women.
The real mother asks the king to spare the child's life.

tn.ref: her heart was full of compassion for her son
tn.text: The heart is spoken of as if it were a container and compassion as if it were a solid object. AT: "she greatly loved her baby" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
all Israel This is a generalization. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
